session_title: Basics of Web Mapping
session_description: Unlike static, printed maps, web maps are interactive, hosted online, and easy to share and collaborate with others. Whether you're a seasoned geographic information systems (GIS) pro or a curious cartographer, this session will provide you with an introduction to web-mapping terminology, techniques and platforms.
speaker_title_org_1: 2015 Richmond Fellow, Code for America
speaker_title_org_2: 2015 Pittsburgh Fellow, Code for America

session_title: Low-Tech Ways to Expand Reach in Your Community
session_description: Who’s showing up to your city events? Are they representative? Join us for a hands-on session where we will use a free online tool to understand your city’s demographics, then come up with a plan on how to diversify your next event. Learn how to keep track of who shows up to events and how to continuously expand and improve your engagement methods.
speaker_title_org_1: Senior Fellow, Code for America

session_title: Breaking the Opaque Frame: Bringing Data, Tech and the Internet to Government Purchasing
session_description: Come learn how the fundamentals of technology and the internet - transparency, collaboration, data-informed decision-making and new ways of sharing - are creating enormous efficiencies in the way governments source and buy products and services. You'll walk away with tangible steps your municipality can take to help realize these efficiencies.
speaker_title_org_1: EVP - Government Sector, SmartProcure

session_title: How to Engage in Open Source Projects
session_description: There's a lot of rhetoric about how great it is to work in the open and using open source code. This session is for beginners to learn the basics of Github, a popular tool for open source projects. Learn how to read or contribute to open source projects, make good documentation, and more.
speaker_title_org_1: Developer, DataMade

session_title: Multi-Jurisdictional Open Data: When Governments Play Nicely
session_description: Open data and open source have made it easier than ever to create solutions to effectively manage data across jurisdictions and agencies. Hear how Atlanta takes a regional approach to sharing transportation data, how it is powering real-time traveler information, and why this is so important for efficient internal data management.
speaker_title_org_1: Transportation Technologist, Atlanta Regional Commission

session_title: City Analytics: A Government Web Reporting Kit You Can Set and Forget
session_description: Web analytics should produce actionable reporting to better serve citizen needs. Measuring actions like downloads, form completions, and even frustrated behavior used to require page-by-page code customization. Learn about the City of Philadelphia's analytics tool any government can use—and leave with your own configuration ready to launch.
speaker_title_org_1: Senior Data Scientist, City of Philadelphia

session_title: Beyond Code: Building Data Standards on GitHub
session_description: Common standards for the data that is released by governments is the next frontier in the open data movement. Find out how GitHub is being used for more than just code, and is being used as a vehicle for collaboration around powerful new data standards for state and local governments across the country.
speaker_title_org_1: Developer Evangelist, Accela
speaker_title_org_2: Senior Advisor, Financial Transparency, U.S. Department of the Treasury
speaker_title_org_3: Senior Advisor, Office of the Fiscal Assistant Secretary, U.S. Treasury

session_title: Delivering Digital Services on a 21st Century Stack
session_description: The redesign of phila.gov is giving the City of Philadelphia the opportunity to rethink how it delivers digital services. In this session, Learn the architecture of those services and examine our adoption of the tools and processes behind them, including AWS OpsWorks, GitHub, reverse proxies, HTTPS always, and continuous delivery.
speaker_title_org_1: Digital Services Architect, City of Philadelphia
speaker_title_org_2: Civic Technology Engineer, City of Philadelphia

session_title: Introduction (or Overview?) to Code for America's Mission and Strategy
Organized Transparency: Using Waffle.io to design, plan, and develop in the open (Sponsored by Rally)
session_description:
Do your teams’ projects start off on a good foot, but never get finished? Does the idea of transparent project management sound intriguing, but not sure where to start? 

Learn from a panel of leaders and practitioners who have discovered the right culture, processes, and tools to effectively get things done, while maintaining an open and transparent workflow.
speaker_title_org_1: Chief Waffle Make, Waffle.io
speaker_title_org_2: Deputy Chief Data Officer, US Department of Commerce
speaker_title_org_3: Co-Captain, Code for Durham & Program Manager, Open Raleigh
speaker_title_org_4: Co-captain, Code for Greensboro  & Tiny Goat Studio, Co-founder
speaker_title_org_5: Co-Captain, Code for Denver & Software Engineer, Rally

session_title: Visual Communication 101: Writing and Designing Instructions
session_description: Want to help people understand a process or how to do something? Together, we’ll discuss and critique a few instructions, how-tos, and handouts from government agencies. You’ll learn some specific tips for designing content and layout, and practice redesigning some instructions yourself. No design skills required!
speaker_title_org_1: Designer, Code for America

session_title: How Googlers helped San Francisco Use Data Science to Understand A Surge in 911 Calls (Sponsored by Google)
session_description: This year, the San Francisco Mayor’s Office of Civic Innovation piloted a program called Civic Bridge that bring pro-bono private sector experts into City departments to help with pressing challenges. At this panel discussion, panelists from Google and the City of San Francisco will share their experiences with a project in which Googlers worked with the Department of Emergency Management to help them understand their increase in 911 calls.
speaker_title_org_1: Program Manager, Google
speaker_title_org_2: Chief Innovation Officer, City and County of San Francisco
speaker_title_org_3: Deputy Director, San Francisco Department of Emergency Management

session_title: Privacy - Microsoft
Quality vs. Quantity? Developing Strategies to Release Valuable, High-Quality Open Data
session_description: Municipalities across the United States have set up online data portals, allowing residents to access everything from city expenditures to 311 service calls. Panelists will discuss the common barriers cities must overcome when implementing open data programs. Special attention will be paid to data quality and the strategies cities should adopt to regularly release high-quality, valuable datasets to residents and other external stakeholders.
speaker_title_org_1: Chief Innovation Officer, eRepublic
speaker_title_org_2: Director of Open Data Johns Hopkins University Center for Government Excellence
speaker_title_org_3: ‎Senior Analyst, What Works Center for Government Excellence, Johns Hopkins University

session_title: Community-Building for Diversity and Inclusivity
session_description: Code for Philly shares their successes and challenges in cultivating cohesion among their diverse volunteer community. This session will include goal setting and strategies for moving towards more inclusive Brigade chapters.
speaker_title_org_1: Co-Captain, Code for Philly
speaker_title_org_2: Co-Captain, Code for Philly

session_title: Business Engagement Design Workshop
session_description: One of the biggest opportunities for governments to better engage with their business community is to rethink the permitting process and interactions required to start a business. Join us for a design workshop and apply user-centered approaches to re-design how governments and businesses interact in your community
speaker_title_org_1: Director of Economic Development, Code for America
speaker_title_org_2: User Experience Lead, Code for America

session_title: Digital Inclusion Meets Civic Tech: Today, Tomorrow, and Beyond
session_description: The civic technology movement will only succeed in positively revolutionizing the relationship among government, institutions, and citizens if all community members have the tools and skills to engage in democracy.  In this session, participants will learn how cities are positioning digital literacy within their overall broadband visions and explore innovative digital literacy initiatives underway at the local level.
speaker_title_org_1: Founder, Digital Equity Project
speaker_title_org_2: Executive Director, Next Century Cities
speaker_title_org_6: Co-founder and CEO, Hack the Hood

session_title: Code for America's Alpha Bootcamp Spotlight
session_description: Code for America helds it first bootcamp this summer for governments around the country embarking on website redesigns. Hear from the participants during a "show-and-tell", and learn what they plan to tackle next in their redesign process.
speaker_title_org_1: Product Growth, Code for America
speaker_title_org_2: Interim Director of Communications & Engagement, Code for America

session_title: The Top 10 Mistakes Civic Startups Make When Pitching to Government
session_description: When governments partner with civic technologists to solve real problems, magic can happen. But all too often these opportunities are missed because both parties do not speak the same language. Come learn (and practice) the do’s, the don’ts, and the how’s of how to pitch civic tech to governments.
speaker_title_org_1: Mayor, City of Somerville
speaker_title_org_2: Chief of Staff, City of Somerville
speaker_title_org_3: Director of Communications, City of Somerville
speaker_title_org_4: Director of Innovation and Analytics, City of Somerville

session_title: Root Cause Analysis & Performance Management
session_description: Trying to improve your government department's performance? Learn why root cause data can be more actionable than data for key performance indicators, and what needs to be done to change information systems to capture root cause data.
speaker_title_org_1: Director of Quality & Performance, Louisville Metro Government
speaker_title_org_2: Performance Coach, Louisville Metro Government
speaker_title_org_3: Senior Organizational Performance Analyst, Louisville Metro Government

session_title: Understanding the Civic Engagement Standard
session_description: TBD
speaker_title_org_1: Senior Director of Partnerships and Ecosystem, Code for America

session_title: Open Your City's Buildings and Addresses, and Help the Blind with Open Street Map
session_description: Louisville's Brigade, the city of Louisville, and the American Printing House for the Blind worked together to open geospatial data to help the visually impaired navigate their city using a mobile app. See how the Nearby Explorer app gives audible cues about the user's surroundings, learn how to effectively work with your city to open the data, and the best ways to organize brigade volunteers to load it into Open Street Map for the blind to use.
speaker_title_org_1: Brigade Captain, Louisville Civic Data Alliance
speaker_title_org_2: Chief of Performance & Technology, Louisville Metro Government

session_title: Linkedin Economic Graph
session_description: TBD

session_title: Communicating With Citizens Using Data Visualization (Sponsored by Microsoft)
session_description: In this era of exploding data collection, analysis, and mining, data visualization as a way of communicating has never been more important-- especially between governments and the communities they serve. Hear from those who have used visualization to engage citizens around government transparency, transportation issues, urban planning, and environmental resiliency.
speaker_title_org_1: Director of Tech & Civic Innovation for Chicago, Microsoft
speaker_title_org_2: Fellow, Lincoln Institute of Land Policy and Director, Civic Innovation Project
speaker_title_org_3: Director of Data Services, Boston’s Metropolitan Area Planning Council
speaker_title_org_5: Director of Internet of Everything, Cisco

session_title: Urban Prototyping Festival
Extra notes: This will be a walking tour and not held in a breakout room

session_title: The Municipal Data Scientist: How Python Can Explain Your Neighborhood
session_description: Data Scientist may be the “sexiest job of the 21st Century,” as HBR put it, but it’s not a title you see in many municipal budgets – at least not yet. Hear from data scientists working in Boston and Somerville about how their role is critical to a data-driven workforce.
speaker_title_org_1: Chief of Staff, City of Somerville
speaker_title_org_2: Principal Data Scientist, Boston

session_title: Open Policing: How Transparency can Lead to Trust, Community Engagement, and Positive Outcomes (Sponsored by Socrata)
session_description: Across the nation, a new movement is sweeping into public safety practices. Cities, counties, and states are increasingly leveraging open data to build trust within communities and start a dialog between police departments and citizens. Technology and data, when applied thoughtfully, have been proven to help strengthen relations between communities and their law enforcement agencies. Come learn more about this movement and hear reports from the field.

session_title: Behind the Wireframes: 5 Case Studies in Civic Design
session_description:
Our public services are the ultimate legacy systems. For designers, understanding and addressing user needs can be far more challenging in this context—layered with years of administrative and policy change— than in "greenfield" product design. As a result, successful service design and product development is often highly idiosyncratic. 
Join five designers working in and around civic institutions as they go behind the scenes to let us in on what it's really like to redesign public services and tools for government. We will hear stories of balancing good design methods with government constraints to the challenges in building effective and diverse design teams.
speaker_title_org_1: Designer, Code for America
speaker_title_org_2: Product and Service Designer, United States Digital Service
speaker_title_org_4: Designer, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

session_title: Agile Procurement
session_description: TBD
speaker_title_org_1: Civic Innovation Fellow, San Francisco Mayor's Office

session_title: Safety First: Prioritizing Privacy in Civic Technology Projects
session_description: Making the web an empowering and secure place for users is not just possible -- in 2015, it's a necessity. This session will cover the concepts and best practices to meet this responsibility in civic technology projects and beyond. Learn practical steps for using standard industry practices around third party services, network encryption, and user anonymization.
speaker_title_org_1: Developer, 18F

session_title: Putting Citizen Surveys To Work
session_description: The City of Kansas City has conducted a citizen survey since 2000 and has learned a few things along the way. Learn what questions to ask, how to incorporate survey data into discussions about city operations, and how to celebrate successes. Hear how Kansas City has put its citizen survey to use in measuring high-level outcomes and prioritizing service delivery.
speaker_title_org_1: Deputy Performance Officer, City of Kansas City, MO

session_title: Pattern Portfolios: A Tool for Fast, Consistent Web Development
session_description: Cut down on development time with a consistent, one-stop-shop for in-house developers and consultants when beginning a web-based project. No more guessing what colors your site should use or how to use them. We'll help you get started on giving your websites a consistent look and feel.
speaker_title_org_1: ‎Front-End Web Developer, City of Philadelphia

session_title: Reinventing from Within: Enabling IT Innovation from Inside Government
session_description: Tired of dealing with stakeholders who don't seem to “get” IT projects? Facing organizational resistance when implementing Agile methodologies? Find out some of the ways that the Applications Group within the City of Albuquerque Department of Technology and Innovation has been thinking about some of these problems.
speaker_title_org_1: Applications Services Group Manager, City of Albuquerque

session_title: OpenAddresses
session_description: TBD
speaker_title_org_1: Chief Technology Officer, Code for America

session_title: Beyond the PDF Data Report: New Ways for Government to Communicate Health Data
session_description: How can local governments harness data to achieve social impact – e.g. raising public awareness of issues, informing policy decisions, curbing unhealthy behaviors? For years, PDF reports have been the standard way governments communicate data. Now, a number of California communities are employing new methods to translate and engage communities with health data. Come join a discussion about how we all can better leverage data to push for social change.
speaker_title_org_1: Associate Director for External Engagement, California HealthCare Foundation
speaker_title_org_2: Director, Office of Strategy and Innovation Health and Human Services Agency County of San Diego
speaker_title_org_3: Owner, Riphagen Consulting and Policy Evangelist, Code for Sacramento
speaker_title_org_4: Public Health Officer, Marin County Health and Human Services

session_title: Using Journey Mapping to Uncover Unmet User Needs and Develop New Services
session_description: The use of a service is only part of a user’s journey. First users have to discover your service, relate it to what they are trying to accomplish and complete a series of related tasks. Learn how we use journey mapping to uncover unmet user needs and prioritize new service creation. We’ll showcase how we have used this powerful design tool and help you put it to practice.
speaker_title_org_1: Chief Data Officer, ‎City and County of San Francisco
speaker_title_org_2: Open Data Program Manager, City and County of San Francisco

session_title: Retos Públicos: Attracting Companies to Civic Tech Through an Open Procurement Process
session_description: Mexico's Retos Públicos program is an open procurement process for government IT. Learn more about the process, and how it's creating new business opportunities for small and medium sized enterprises in Mexico.
speaker_title_org_1: Co-founder, Codeando México
speaker_title_org_2: Co-founder, Codeando México

session_title: Building Digital Tools for Legal Service Providers
session_description: For every low-income person who receives federally funded legal services, another is turned away; millions of people in the US need help interfacing with government agencies. In this hour long breakout session, we’ll explore user needs of legal advocates who help low-income individuals navigate government services. We’ll begin with a panel to learn from those in the forefront of this supportive work. Then we’ll open it up for conversation.
speaker_title_org_1: Fellow, Code for America
speaker_title_org_2: Lecturer, Stanford Institute of Design
speaker_title_org_3: Executive Director, Bay Area Legal Aid

session_title: Using Human Design to Improve Social Services Delivery
session_description: mRelief.com, the organization dedicated to modernizing public benefits with an unprecedented use of SMS in social services eligibility determination, joins forces with Code for Anchorage to discuss how human centered design can inform technology focused on improving social services delivery. Through interactive exercises, we’ll share best practices for collaborations between government and developers from ideation to delivery.
speaker_title_org_1: Co-founder and CTO, mRelief
speaker_title_org_2: Co-founder and Project Manager, mRelief

session_title: The White House Police Data Initiative: Using Open Data and Technology to Build Trust, Increase Transparency, and Engage the Community
session_description: Beginning with protests in Ferguson, MO in the fall of 2014, the relationship between police departments and communities of color has moved to the center of national conversation. Learn more about the White House's Initiative, its progress to date, and how the Code for America community can support it.
speaker_title_org_1: Presidential Innovation Fellow, U.S. Department of Energy

session_title: Change My Record: Hacking the Process and Changing People's Lives
session_description: Come learn how Code for America is helping Californians remove old low-level felonies from their criminal records and transform their lives with access to employment and housing. Demo a tool that makes the reclassification process user-friendly and the deadline for applications rapidly nears. As a civic technologist or government representative, what do you do?
speaker_title_org_1: 2014 Fellow, Code for America

session_title: Opportunity@work session
session_description: TBD

session_title: Community Spotlight: Jersey City's Public Safety Alert System
session_description: Learn how Open Jersey City is collaborating with government, residents, and donors on a public service alert (PSA) project that uses 911 public safety data to help raise resident awareness and create safer neighborhoods. Demo their PSA tool, and learn how to replicate a similar approach to community policing and reporting in your city.
speaker_title_org_1: Co-Executive Director and Founding Partner, Open JC
speaker_title_org_2: Director of Innovation, City of Jersey City
speaker_title_org_3: Co-Executive Director and Founding Partner, Open JC

session_title: Case Study from North Carolina: Identifying Racial Bias in Policing Practices
session_description: North Carolina developers and civil rights advocates used demographic data from nearly 20,000,000 unique traffic stops in the state to create a digital tool for identifying race-based policing practices. Come learn more about the process and how they using it to challenge these practices in the courts.
speaker_title_org_1: Staff Attorney, Southern Coalition for Social Justice
speaker_title_org_2: Co-captain, Code for Durham Brigade

session_title: Building User-Friendly Tools: Lessons Learned from the City of Asheville
session_description: Learn how the City of Asheville used user-centered design and Lean Startup principles in the real world to build a web app for accessing city information that both citizens and city employees actually want to use. We'll demo SimpliCity: a simple, user-friendly tool to access community data.
speaker_title_org_1: GIS Analyst, City of Asheville
speaker_title_org_2: GIS Analyst, City of Ashville

session_title: Fallow Ground into Fertile Space: How to Build an Innovation Space in City Hall
session_description: Get started bringing an Innovation Lab to your government! Learn how to create inter-departmental and cross-sector approaches to changing the way government does business. Using The City of Oakland's The Civic Design Lab as a case study, we'll walk through the process of standing up an Innovation Lab from idea to reality- including logistics, budget, and strategy.
speaker_title_org_1: Online Engagement Manager, City of Oakland
speaker_title_org_2: Chief Strategy Officer, Neighborly

session_title: Kicking off a City Hall Analytics Shop
session_description: Interested in municipal analytics? Want to start an analytics shop in your city? We'll help you get started, earn organizational buy-in, select projects, and much more. Hear stories and lessons learned from veterans in Los Angeles, New York City, and New Orleans.
speaker_title_org_1: Director of Performance and Accountability, City of New Orleans
speaker_title_org_2: Chief Analytics Officer, Enigma
speaker_title_org_3: Chief Data Officer, City of Los Angeles

session_title: The Enterprise Model
session_description: See how LouieStat's Enterprise Model tool helps agencies evaluate how well they are doing on meeting their mission and goals as well as support managers in making more informed, data-driven decisions. Learn more about this tool and how it can be used to help an organization improve.
speaker_title_org_1: Director of Quality & Performance, Louisville Metro Government
speaker_title_org_2: Performance Coach, Louisville Metro Government
speaker_title_org_3: Senior Organizational Performance Analyst, Louisville Metro Government

session_title: United States Digital Service + 18F Overview
Recording?: I don't think so (we should double check with Lauren)
session_description: Come hear the inspiring true stories about the important work underway by the United States Digital Service and 18F to bring best practices from engineering, product management, and design to help transform the way government works for the American people.
speaker_title_org_1: Talent, United States Digital Service
speaker_title_org_2: Tech Advisor, the White House

session_title: Content Design: What It Is and Why You Need It
session_description: If you'd like to make your web content clearer, more understandable, and easier to navigate, chances are good your site needs content design. In this session, we'll go over ways to assess, revise, and create content so that it meets key user needs.
speaker_title_org_1: Lead Content Designer, City of Philadelphia

session_title: Build With, Not For: A Hands-on Workshop for Community-Led Development
session_description: This interactive workshop is a guided, brass-tacks conversation about how to build technology for public good with the communities you intend to serve. We’ll review new research from Laurenellen McCann and the Smart Chicago Collaborative on how real practitioners from a variety of different contexts co-develop, co-design, and co-deliver civic technology. You’ll walk away with a framework for developing an engagement plan that puts community at the core of your work.
speaker_title_org_1: Civic Innovation Fellow, Institute New America Foundation

session_title: Designing for Regulation at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
session_description: As the design team at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has grown, we’ve moved from designing basic reports and templates to designing for federal financial regulation. When designers are at the rule-making table, we can help consider user-centered systems for financial disclosure, shaping the way we interact with consumers and the financial industry. We’ll discuss new mortgage and prepaid disclosure designs, and the CFPB websites that support them.
speaker_title_org_1: Graphic Designer, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
speaker_title_org_2: UX Design Fellow, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

session_title: Civic User Testing Group (CUTGroup) as a New Model for UX Testing, Digital Skills Development, and Community Engagement
session_description: The Civic User Testing Group (CUTGroup) is a community of residents who get paid to test civic websites and apps, and help create better software. Through the CUTGroup, Smart Chicago has created a platform for meaningful collaboration between residents and developers around data and technology. Sonja Marziano of the Smart Chicago Collaborative will share tools and processes to run a successful CUTGroup that centers around the voice of the resident.
speaker_title_org_1: Project Coordinator, SmartChicago Collaborative

session_title: Introduction to CfA's Safety & Justice Focus Area
session_description: Getting the right information to the right person at the right time -- in the right way -- can make our communities safer and more just. Come learn how Code for America partners with local governments, foundations, and others to make our public safety and criminal justice systems work for the people, by the people, in the 21st century.
speaker_title_org_1: Director of Safety and Justice, Code for America

session_title: With the People: How to Partner with the Outside to Do Better Government Together
session_description: Much of the current thinking in civic technology involves the idea of “getting technologists to come to government.” But what about the other way around?  Learn what's worked and lessons learned from MassIT's engagement with the Boston tech community.
speaker_title_org_1: Director of Strategic Partnerships, Massachusetts Office of Information Technology

session_title: Affordable Analytics: Leveraging Open Source Software To Measure What Matters
session_description: Learn about the Open Justice Broker Consortium and how its growing membership is collaborating on development of an information-sharing platform for justice built on open source software, including a recent focus on developing analytics tools to better understand justice-involved populations and programs.  Explore the applicability of OJBC-like models and open source analytics tools to government generally.
speaker_title_org_1: ‎Executive Director, SEARCH

session_title: Engaging youth in designing community health services
session_description: TBD

session_title: Building Blocks of Agile
session_description: Frustrated by missing deadlines and making things customers don't actually want? Interested in agile but don't know how to start using it in your organization? Join us for step-by-step instructions to learn agile methodologies using LEGOs.
speaker_title_org_1: Developer, Code for America
speaker_title_org_2: Software Developer, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

session_title: Lessons from Organizing the Chi Hack Night
session_description: Trying to grow civic hacking in your community? Learn how the Chi Hack Night went from four nerds sitting in a room to a weekly event with 80-100 talented volunteers working to create more just, equitable, transparent and delightful cities through exciting applications of data and technology.
speaker_title_org_1: Founder and Partner, DataMade
speaker_title_org_2: Interaction Designer, University of Chicago

session_title: You Published Some Data. So What?
session_description: Every open data program must do more than simply publish data - it must directly create value for each stakeholder in the data chain. Learn how strategic data releases can create immediate value for both your internal staff and local community.
speaker_title_org_1: Chief Data Officer, City and County of San Francisco
speaker_title_org_2: Open Data Program Manager, City and County of San Francisco

session_title: Cutting Red Tape: Making Local Government Work Better For Business
Extra notes: Abhi is also on Kicking Off an Analytics Show in City Hall panel
session_description: Governments are working hard to streamline their permitting and licensing processes and create more welcoming environments for small-businesses and support overall job growth. Hear stories from some of the White House's Start Up in a Day grant winers (San Francisco, Los Angeles and Boston) about how they are improving government and business interactions.
speaker_title_org_1: Chief Data Officer, City of Los Angeles
speaker_title_org_2: Co-Founder, Open Counter Enterprises Inc.
speaker_title_org_3: Program Director, Office of Technology, City of San Francisco
speaker_title_org_4: Office of Intergovernmental Affairs, U.S. Small Business Administration

session_title: Becoming a What Works City
session_description: Michele Jolin will moderate a discussion with city leaders who are at the forefront of the national movement to use evidence and data to get better results for their city residents. As part of Bloomberg Philanthropies’ What Works Cities, these leaders are implementing tested and proven strategies to make government more effective, from open data and performance management to low-cost evaluations and results-driven contracting. Join this session to hear about this national movement, as well as what it means to be a What Works City.
speaker_title_org_1: CEO, Results for America
speaker_title_org_2: Chief of Performance & Technology, Louisville Metro Government
speaker_title_org_3: Director of Performance and Accountability, City of New Orleans
speaker_title_org_4: Deputy Mayor of Operations, City of Seattle
speaker_title_org_5: Executive Director, Johns Hopkins University Center for Government Excellence

session_title: Participatory Budgeting: Community Engagement in Real Budget Decisions
session_description: Participatory Budgeting (PB) builds valuable civic skills and knowledge, engages communities in real decisions, and develops stronger relationships with local officials through what they NY Times calls “revolutionary civics in action.” Learn why local officials across North America are turning to PB and leave with concrete strategies to bring PB to your community.
speaker_title_org_1: Data & Tech Manager, Participatory Budgeting Project
speaker_title_org_2: City Councilwoman, City of Vallejo, CA

session_title: Cutting Red Tape: Making Local Government Work Better For Business
United States Digital Service + 18F Overview (part 2)
session_description: doesn't need description

session_title: USDS Session Part 2
Recording?: Same room as above, but this part doesn't need to be recorded. (It's a reception)
speaker_title_org_1: Talent, United States Digital Service

session_title: Health Data: Creating a New Generation of Smarter, Agile, Public Health Actions
session_description: From healthcare to community initiatives, from social media to social services, and from criminal justice to education, data is crucial to the transformation of the health industry. Across the country, we're seeing actionable data as a key force to solving public health challenges. In this session, learn how Public Health Officials are leveraging open data, data integration, informatics, and predictive analytics to solve some of our most pressing problems.
speaker_name_1: Jay Bhatt, DO, MPH, MPA, FACP
speaker_title_org_1: Chief Health Officer, Illinois Hospital Association
speaker_title_org_2: Director of System Planning, Improvement, and Data Analytics, Los Angeles County Department of Health Services
speaker_name_3: Leslie Upledger Ray, MPH, MPPA, MA
speaker_title_org_3: Senior Epidemiologist County of San Diego Health and Human Services Agency

session_title: Sponsored #2   TROPO
Sponsored #3   ACCELA
Sponsored #7
Sponsored #8
Sponsored #9
Sponsored #10
Accelerating Civic Innovation with City Software Development Kits
session_description: City Software Development Kits (SDK) unlock the value of Census data and enable improved access, discovery, and usability of a variety of open datasets. Learn how City SDK have the potential to streamline the creation of civic apps powered by open data.
speaker_title_org_1: Presidential Innovation Fellow, U.S. Department of Commerce
speaker_title_org_2: Presidential Innovation Fellow, U.S. Census Bureau

session_title: LiveStories
